message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.NE 

Reasoning: This paper describes a fully automated translation system that uses a catalogue of predefined phrases and predetermined rules to translate sentences from German into French, Italian, and English. This system involves natural language processing (NLP) techniques and machine learning algorithms, which are commonly studied in the arXiv CS sub-categories of computational linguistics (cs.CL), artificial intelligence (cs.AI), and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the evaluation of the translation system, which involves assessing the quality of the produced texts based on user ratings, a topic that falls under the sub-categories of information retrieval (cs.IR) and neural networks (cs.NE).
